articles.author: James Mackenzie, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Samia Nakhoul
articles.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah militant group said on Friday it was moving to a new and escalating phase in its war against Israel while Iran said "the spirit of resistance will be strengthened" after the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar.
articles.title: Hezbollah says it will escalate war with Israel after Hamas leader killed

articles.author: Jonathan Saul, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli troops were initially unaware they'd caught their number one enemy, officials said.
articles.title: Sinwar's death came at the end of months of searching by Israel

articles.author: Sarah Marsh, Jeff Mason
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden will on Friday seek to cement cooperation with key European partners on issues from the Ukraine war to conflict in the Middle East during a swift swansong trip to Berlin.
articles.title: Biden to discuss Ukraine with allies on swansong Berlin trip

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said South Korea is a foreign and hostile country, state media KCNA said on Friday.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un says South Korea is a foreign, hostile country, KCNA says

articles.author: George Obulutsa
articles.description: Kenya's President William Ruto has nominated interior minister Kithure Kindiki as his new deputy president, a day after the Senate voted to impeach Ruto's previous deputy Rigathi Gachagua.
articles.title: Kenya's Ruto chooses interior minister as new deputy

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will attend the 16th BRICS summit in Kazan, Russia, from Oct. 22 to 24, the Chinese foreign ministry said on Friday.
articles.title: China's President Xi to attend BRICS summit in Russia

articles.author: Anna Mehler Paperny
articles.description: Twice since July 2022, Moninder Singh, spokesperson for a Sikh advocacy group in Canada's British Columbia province, has had police come to his door in the Vancouver suburb of Surrey.
articles.title: Warned by police, some of Canada's Sikhs feel threatened by India

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indonesian police and military started deploying at least 100,000 personnel across the capital Jakarta on Friday, officials said, as the country prepares for the inauguration of President-elect Prabowo Subianto this weekend.
articles.title: Indonesia ramps up security ahead of Prabowo's inauguration

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te thanked the air force on Friday for their "outstanding" work during Chinese war games around the island earlier this week, telling them to keep up the good work.
articles.title: Taiwan president thanks air force for 'outstanding' work during China war games

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia is testing the combat readiness of a unit equipped with Yars intercontinental ballistic missiles in a region northwest of Moscow, news agencies quoted the defence ministry as saying on Friday.
articles.title: Russia tests readiness of nuclear missile unit
